intro: Condalia lloydii, commonly known as the Lloyd's condalia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
